Create comprehensive API reference documentation.

tool_call: contentManager_createContent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731705500000_x1y2z3a4b", "workspaceId": "ws_1731705500000_c5d6e7f8g", "sessionDescription": "Creating API reference", "sessionMemory": "Documentation project", "toolContext": "API documentation", "primaryGoal": "Document APIs", "subgoal": "Create reference docs"}, "filePath": "/docs/api/reference.md", "content": "# API Reference

## Authentication

All API requests require authentication via JWT token in the Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Bearer <token>
```

## Base URL

```
https://api.example.com/v1
```

## Endpoints

### Users

#### GET /users

Retrieve list of users.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` (integer): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (integer): Results per page (default: 20, max: 100)
- `sort` (string): Sort field (created_at, updated_at, name)

**Response:**
```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "user_123",
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "created_at": "2023-11-01T10:00:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "limit": 20,
    "total": 150
  }
}
```

#### POST /users

Create new user.

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "name": "John Doe",
  "email": "john@example.com",
  "password": "SecurePass123!"
}
```

**Response:** 201 Created

### Products

#### GET /products/:id

Retrieve product by ID.

**Response:**
```json
{
  "id": "prod_456",
  "name": "Product Name",
  "price": 29.99,
  "in_stock": true
}
```

## Rate Limiting

- 1000 requests/hour per API key
- Rate limit headers included in responses

## Error Codes

- 400: Bad Request
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Forbidden
- 404: Not Found
- 429: Too Many Requests
- 500: Internal Server Error"}

Result: {"created": true, "filePath": "/docs/api/reference.md", "size": 1567}

Created comprehensive API reference documentation covering authentication, endpoints, rate limiting, and error codes.

Create incident response playbook documentation.

tool_call: contentManager_createContent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731706300000_e9f0g1h2i", "workspaceId": "ws_1731706300000_j3k4l5m6n", "sessionDescription": "Creating incident playbook", "sessionMemory": "Operations documentation", "toolContext": "Playbook creation", "primaryGoal": "Document incident response", "subgoal": "Create playbook"}, "filePath": "/docs/operations/incident-response.md", "content": "# Incident Response Playbook

## Severity Levels

### SEV1 (Critical)
- Complete service outage
- Data breach
- Response time: Immediate
- Escalation: CTO + Security team

### SEV2 (High)
- Partial service degradation
- Performance issues affecting >50% users
- Response time: 15 minutes
- Escalation: Engineering manager

### SEV3 (Medium)
- Minor feature issues
- Performance issues affecting <50% users
- Response time: 1 hour
- Escalation: Team lead

## Response Steps

### 1. Detection & Alert
- Automated monitoring triggers alert
- On-call engineer paged
- Create incident ticket

### 2. Assessment
- Determine severity level
- Identify affected systems
- Estimate impact
- Notify stakeholders

### 3. Communication
- Post in #incidents channel
- Update status page
- Notify customers (SEV1/SEV2)

### 4. Investigation
- Review logs and metrics
- Identify root cause
- Document findings

### 5. Mitigation
- Apply immediate fixes
- Deploy hotfix if needed
- Verify resolution

### 6. Recovery
- Restore normal operations
- Verify all systems healthy
- Clear alerts

### 7. Post-Mortem
- Schedule within 48 hours
- Document timeline
- Identify action items
- Update runbooks

## Contacts

- On-Call: #oncall-engineering
- Security: security@example.com
- Customer Support: #support
- Executive: exec-oncall@example.com"}
